topic.title: DCN Integration with Multisite Support for Neutron

section.title: HPE Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) capabilities in
section.p: HPE Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) is network overlay software that enables network virtualization both within data centers and between them. allows you to use DCN as your networking. This choice is an all-or-nothing option in that you cannot use traditional networking in if you choose to use DCN.

For that reason, and others, you cannot upgrade an existing installation of to with DCN. The network configuration you had previously will not work. Therefore, to use DCN, you must install as a new deployment, and follow the steps outlined in these documents.

section.title: Features not available when DCN is deployed
section.p: Because of the foundational differences between DCN networks and traditional networking, when DCN is running in , these features are not deployed:
section.note: DCN has a neutron-server component (DCN-ML2 or DCN-CORE-PLG), VRS and a medatata-agent (which are essentially replacements for neutron OVS, L3, and DHCP, and metadata agents).

section.title: Notes about deploying DCN in

ol.li: Neutron-server must be running with either the Nuage mechanism driver (DCN-ML2) or the core-plugin (DCN-CORE-PLG). DCN-ML2 is preferred.
VRS with the Nuage metadata-agent and VRS-G. VRS runs on compute nodes, VRS-G runs on a standalone node.
(Optional): Virtualized services controller (VSC) There are two ways to have VSC(s) deployed, one via playbooks and another via bringing up the provided VSC VM disk image.
The external components you must download will need to be "staged" for deployment into using the third-party import mechanism. The third-party import playbook does the staging.
After running the third-party import playbook, needs to be configured for DCN.
(Optional) If VSC is to be deployed via playbooks, you will need to perform additional configuration steps and run the configuration processor again.
Run the standard steps to deploy.

section.note: Additional steps are required if VSC is deployed via playbooks. See next section for details.
